alert.note: Alert for Ashtabula Inland; Geauga; Lake; Portage; Summit; Trumbull (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 24 at 4:42AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of north central Ohio, northeast Ohio and northwest Ohio, including the following areas, in north central Ohio, Ashland, Crawford, Erie, Huron, Knox, Lorain, Marion, Morrow and Richland. In northeast Ohio, Ashtabula Inland, Ashtabula Lakeshore, Cuyahoga, Geauga, Holmes, Lake, Mahoning, Medina, Portage, Stark, Summit, Trumbull and Wayne. In northwest Ohio, Ottawa, Sandusky, Seneca and Wyandot. * WHEN...Through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall from Wednesday and Wednesday night has totaled 2 to 8 inches across northern Ohio with flooding already ongoing in portions of the area. Showers and thunderstorms should move out of the area later this morning and allow for flooded areas to drain out and water to recede. However, an additional round of robust showers and thunderstorms is expected this evening into tonight and may bring an additional 1 to 3 inches of rain across the area with some isolated higher amounts possible. Additional flooding is possible across the region through tonight. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Ashtabula Inland; Geauga; Lake; Portage; Summit; Trumbull
